intro: Busbeckea ornans, commonly known as the Christmas bell, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowering period occurs during the winter months, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. The plant is well adapted to dry conditions and thrives in full sun.
